title: Heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says the  atmospheric conditions are favorable for afternoon thundershowers in most parts of the island.

title: Doctors launch token strike at Karapitiya Teaching Hospital
byline: Doctors at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital in Galle have commenced a 24-hour token strike, according to the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA).

title: Serbian railway station roof collapse in Novi Sad leaves 14 dead
byline: Rescue workers scoured piles of concrete and twisted metal for survivors on Friday after a roof collapsed at the entrance of a railway station in the Serbian city of Novi Sad, killing 14 people.

title: Suspect arrested at BIA with 76kg of smuggled Cardamom from Dubai
byline: A suspect was arrested with a large consignment of cardamom that had been illegally smuggled into Sri Lanka from Dubai, during a raid conducted by officers from the Airport Police Station at the arrival terminal of Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) in Katunayake last night (01).

title: Lohan Ratwatte transferred to Prison Hospital
byline: Former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who was arrested and remanded on charges of using a luxury car illegally imported from abroad and assembled in Sri Lanka, has been transferred to the prison hospital.

title: President and Indian envoy discuss strengthening ties, fishing disputes, and energy cooperation
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with Indian High Commissioner Santosh Jha yesterday (01) at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: Badulla bus accident: injured KDU students out of danger
byline: Dr. Palitha Rajapaksha of the Emergency Treatment Unit of Badulla Teaching Hospital stated that those who were seriously injured in the bus accident on Dunhinda Road in Badulla last morning (01) and admitted to the hospital, are now out of danger.

title: Special security for Lohan Ratwatte at Prison Hospital
byline: A decision has been taken to provide special security to former State Minister Lohan Ratwatte, who has been admitted to the prison hospital due to an illness.

title: Doctors end token strike at Karapitiya Teaching Hospital
byline: Doctors at the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital in Galle have called off their 24-hour token strike which had commenced at 05.00 p.m. yesterday (01).
